intro: Plagiobothrys scouleri var. penicillatus, commonly known as the Penicillate Stickseed, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly referred to as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive, narrow, and often hairy appearance. This variety is typically found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks.
